titleInfo.title: Letter from John MacLeod, Resident in the Persian Gulf, to Mr Arratoon Melcolm, Linguist, and Mr Essai Johannes, Broker

mods.abstract: The letter directs the Linguist and the Broker to receive charge of the Residency at Bushere [Bushire] until MacLeod's return from the Arabian coast in the beginning of February 1823. MacLeod instructs them on procedures for dealing with East India Company and merchant ships arriving at Bushire in his absence. In addition, he gives them instructions on dealing with letters and dispatches. He also encloses two letters to be distributed to the commander of any of the East India Company's vessels and the commander or master of any merchant ships.
